posts.author: KuzoKevin
posts.title: The definition of "kidnapping" was understood by all.  It was a powerful word reserved for the adduction of innocent people,  Another word has lost immense power for political bullshit.

quotedTweet.content: Today, ICE kidnapped a teacher inside a daycare, in front of little children and parents. This is not making us safer. This brutality needs to stop!

twitter.content:
If politicians truly believed ICE arrests were kidnappings, a serious felony, they would be filing police reports for kidnapping & seeking prosecution.

Instead, it has become a charged word used to describe any immigration enforcement arrest they disagree with.

posts.raw_content:
Anybody who's ever traveled to a South American country would know that when they hear that you're an American they immediately think cha-ching and see you as an unlimited piggy bank to take take 

You're literally warned as a tourist how to avoid scams.. Because people in these third world countries have a scammer mentality. And exploitive mentality where they try to take your money and they see you just as a piggy bank.. They don't care if they end up leaving you broke They don't give a shit what happens to you.. It's all about them getting as much money in one go as possible 

And then these people come as immigrants to America.. What makes you think they don't bring that same mentality when they come as immigrants or refugees? 

They don't come to America because they want to be Americans to assimilate and live in the country as a great American citizen.. They come because they want to take what America can give them. And then they want to send it back to their home country and then their hope is that one day they can return to their home country after taking all they can..

It's the same fucking mentality.. The same third world or South American mentality just on an immigrant scale 

They don't want to be a part of your country They don't even like your country They just see you as a piggy bank 

It's like a gold digger in America but 10 times worse 

Why do we think that they don't have that kind of mentality when they come to America? These people don't belong in America. They're not in America for the right reasons 

It's like an American fleeing to France because they wanted to avoid Donald Trump.. They didn't go to France because they liked being French or because they want to be a part of that country.. They form their own little American enclaves where everyone spoke English and where the food was mostly American.. And frankly they don't belong in that country either. It's not as big a problem because they don't have a massive welfare apparatus to exploit from the French taxpayers nor would they be in such large numbers that it would heavily affect the economy like in America with the 10 million illegal immigrants.. In addition to the 1 million legal ones a year 

But they shouldn't be there anyway.. those Americans shouldn't be in France because they didn't go to France for the right reasons.. And these South Americans from Mexico to Venezuela don't belong in America because they didn't come to America for the right reasons.. They show up in America they go to Miami they form their little enclaves where everyone would speak Spanish. You can go to a fucking major store like Walmart and the employees don't speak a lick of English 

They don't belong in America.. They came to scam you and exploit you. It's that South American tourist trap mentality.. America should care about Americans first. The rest of the world should come second
